Was Broward County one of three counties 'pivotal' for Obama?

There was no surprising headline out of Broward from the election -- the
   county voted for Obama by about the same margin as 2008, and the county’s
   overall turnout was about 67 percent in 2012, placing it the lowest among
   the state’s largest counties.

Our ruling

   The Broward County Democratic Party said in a press release that Broward
   County was "pivotal to an Obama victory" in 2012, citing a news article.

barely-true barely-true
